info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 16 at 8:23AM CDT until June 17 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Denton Creek Near Justin affecting Denton County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Denton Creek near Justin.
* WHEN...From this morning to late tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor out of bank flooding will occur to farm and ranch lands near the creek.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Monday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.1 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.2 feet on 05/16/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TONIGHT
